inputFields.name: expiresIn
inputFields.description:
This argument accepts a string specifying a duration.
It takes a succession of a number (positive integer) and a time unit, one of:
s[econd[s]], m[inute[s]], h[our[s]], d[ay[s]], w[eek[s]], mo[nth[s]].
Number/unit pairs can be contiguous or separated by spaces.
Valid examples: "3d4h" "11 minutes" "2month", "1s", "12 second"
If not provided, target is banned permanently.

isPromo is a flag that signifies if the offer is a promotional offer. This is for clients that

url is the purchase URL to use for this offer.
The url contains a `{channelID}` token which should be replaced by the `User.id` of the channel bits are being purchased from.

types.name: ChatMessage
types.description: Cheer is a chat message that uses bits to include cheermotes.

fields.name: author
fields.description: author is the `User` who sent this message.

fields.name: authorColor
fields.description: authorColor is the sender's preferred display name color at the time the message was sent.

fields.name: authorName
fields.description: authorName is the historical value of `author.displayName` at the time the message was sent.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: badges is the list of `Badge` to display on this message.

fields.name: bitsUsed
fields.description: bitsUsed is the number of bits used in this message.

fields.name: body
fields.description: body is the message content and embedded emote info.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time this message was sent.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique message identifier.

fields.name: bannedUser
fields.description: The user being banned of this chat.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time the ban was imposed.

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: The time at which the ban will automatically expire.

fields.name: isPermanent
fields.description: Conveys if the ban is permanent.

fields.name: moderator
fields.description: The moderator that carried out the action.

fields.name: roomOwner
fields.description: The entity representing the users channel or chat room.

types.name: ChatSettings
types.description: ChatSettings are settings and rules for chatting in a channel.

fields.name: autoModLevel
fields.description:
AutoModLevel is an integer from 0-4 representing the level of automoderation of chat
0 is off, 4 is the highest level of moderation.

fields.name: blockLinks
fields.description: blockLinks indicates if links should be deleted from non-mod messages.

fields.name: chatDelayMs
fields.description: chatDelayMs is the delay before non-mods see a message.

fields.name: isBroadcasterLanguageModeEnabled
fields.description:
isBroadcasterLanguageModeEnabled indicates if the broadcaster requires chat messages to
match their language.

fields.name: isOptedOutOfGlobalBannedWordsList
fields.description:
If isOptedOutOfGlobalBannedWordsList is true, the legacy twitch banned words list will
be inserted into automod if the channel has automod enabled.

fields.name: requireVerifiedAccount
fields.description: requireVerifiedAccount indicates if users must be verified to chat.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: rules is a list of rules to display to users when joining a chat channel.

types.name: ChatTheme
types.description:
ChatTheme is a client-side UI theme.
It can be used to provide different images based on the dominant background color they are designed to display on.

types.name: CheerInfo
types.description: CheerInfo is the channel-specific bits/cheer settings and current state.

fields.name: availableBadges
fields.description: Gets the list of available bits badges the user offers.

fields.name: emotes
fields.description:
emotes are the metadata about the different cheermotes that can be use to cheer in this channel.
This can optionally be filtered to return only certain cheermotes. If `prefixes` is null or empty
all available cheermotes will be returned.

fields.name: hashtags
fields.description:
hashtags for augmenting cheering with different actions, such as #charity will donate bits to
charity, or like #eddie to cheer and support Eddie.

fields.name: leaderboard
fields.description: leaderboard contains the top users by number of bits cheered for the channel.

fields.name: recent
fields.description:
recent is the currently pinned recent cheer.
If no recent cheer is pinned this will be null.

fields.name: recentTimeoutMs
fields.description:
recentTimeoutMs is the remaining duration the recent message will be pinned for.
If no recent cheer is pinned this will be zero.

fields.name: settings
fields.description: settings are the channel-specific cheer settings.

fields.name: top
fields.description:
top is the currently pinned top cheer.
If no top cheer is pinned this will be null.

types.name: CheerPartnerBadgeSettings
types.description: Bits partner settings associated with the badges.

fields.name: tiers
fields.description: A list of tiers, starting from 1 bit to as high as 5,000,000 bits.

types.name: CheerPartnerChatMessageSettings
types.description: Bits partner settings associated with the chat message.

fields.name: minBitsPerEmote
fields.description: The minimum setting that controls the minimum bits that must be part of a cheer emote.

fields.name: minBitsToCheer
fields.description: The minimum setting that controls the minimum amount a user must cheer in the channel.

types.name: CheerPartnerCustomPrefixSettings
types.description: Bits partner settings for custom cheermote prefix.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: Flag that is set if the user has the custom cheermote prefix enabled.

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: The prefix string that is used in their channel for their custom cheermote.

types.name: CheerPartnerLeaderboardSettings
types.description: Bits partner dashboard settings for the bits leaderboard.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: Flag that is true if the user has bits leaderboards turned on.

fields.name: timePeriod
fields.description: The time period the user wants the leaderboard to be displayed as.

types.name: CheerPartnerRecentCheerSettings
types.description: Bits partner settings associated with recent cheers.

fields.name: canPin
fields.description: Flag that when true pins the recent cheer to their channel.

fields.name: minimumBits
fields.description: The minimum bits a user must cheer to show their cheer on the chat header.

fields.name: timeoutMilliseconds
fields.description: The amount of time a recent cheer is shown before being dismissed.

types.name: CheerPartnerSettings
types.description: Cheer settings, configured in their partner dashboard.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: Partner settings related to bit badges.

fields.name: chatMessage
fields.description: Partner settings related to chat messages with bits.

fields.name: customPrefix
fields.description: Partner settings related to the custom cheermote prefix.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An ID used for caching purposes for Apollo.

fields.name: isOnboarded
fields.description: Flag that is set when a user has been onboarded for bits usage.

fields.name: leaderboard
fields.description: Partner settings related to the bits leaderboard.

fields.name: recentCheer
fields.description: Partner settings related to the recent cheer message.

types.name: CheerSettings
types.description: CheerSettings are the channel-specific cheer settings.

fields.name: cheerMinimumBits
fields.description: cheerMinimumBits is the minimum number of bits per message (sum of all cheermotes) required to cheer in this channel.

fields.name: emoteMinimumBits
fields.description: emoteMinimumBits is the smallest number of bits that can be spent on an individual cheermote in this channel.

fields.name: event
fields.description:
event is the name of a special cheering event this channel is currently participating in.
If there is no current event this will return null.

fields.name: isRecentEnabled
fields.description:
isRecentEnabled indicates if recent cheers are pinned in this channel.
This can be used by a client to update `CheerInfo.recent` as new cheers are received.

fields.name: isTopEnabled
fields.description:
isTopEnabled indicates if top cheers are pinned in this channel.
This can be used by a client to update `CheerInfo.top` as new cheers are received.

fields.name: leaderboard
fields.description: leaderboard contains all of the Bits settings related to Bits Leaderboards for this channel.

fields.name: recentMinimumBits
fields.description: recentMinimumBits is the number of bits required for a cheer to be pinned.

fields.name: recentTimeoutMs
fields.description: recentTimeoutMs is the amount of time a pinned recent message should be displayed for.

types.name: Cheermote
types.description: Cheermote is the metadata about different variations of a single cheermote that can be use to cheer in this channel.

fields.name: prefix
fields.description:
prefix for this cheering action (Kappa, cheer, Kreygasm, etc).
Any case-insensitive match of this prefix directly followed by a number
(Kappa100, kappa100, kApPa100, etc) is to be considered a cheering message.

fields.name: tiers
fields.description: tiers are bits breakpoints for different images for this cheermote.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is the kind of cheermote (custom vs 1st- or 3rd-party global).

types.name: CheermoteImage
types.description: CheermoteImage is a single image variation of a `CheermoteTier`.

fields.name: dpiScale
fields.description:
dpiScale is the scale of the cheermote image.
Currently available scales are: 1, 1.5, 2, 3, or 4.

fields.name: isAnimated
fields.description: isAnimated is true for animated cheermotes and false otherwise.

fields.name: theme
fields.description: theme is the UI theme the cheermote is designed to be rendered on.

fields.name: url
fields.description: url is the URL of the image asset.

types.name: CheermoteTier
types.description: CheermoteTier has information about a single tier of a cheermote.

fields.name: bits
fields.description:
bits is the minimum number of bits that are required to render this tier.
To render at this tier the cheemote must have used >= this minimum but < the next smallest tier.

fields.name: canCheer
fields.description: Can this cheer tier be used as a cheermote.

fields.name: color
fields.description: color is the hex color used to render the number of bits for this tier.

fields.name: images
fields.description:
images are urls for the cheermote that match various settings.
This can optionally be filtered to only certain variations or called without arguments to return all available images.

fields.name: tierID
fields.description: tierID of this specific cheermote icon. For "Kappa100" this will be "100".

types.name: CheermoteType
types.description: CheermoteType is the kind of cheermore (custom vs 1st- or 3rd-party global).

types.name: Clip
types.description: A recorded, replayable part of a live broadcast.

fields.name: broadcast
fields.description:
The broadcast of the clip. This should only be used to fetch the ID of the broadcast.
Because not all videos have broadcasts (e.g. uploads), not all clips will have a broadcast.

fields.name: broadcaster
fields.description: The broadcaster from which the clip originated.

fields.name: champBadge
fields.description:
The curator's clip champ badge if it has been attained on the broadcaster's channel.
This will be null if the curator is not a clip champ of the broadcaster's channel.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the clip was created.

fields.name: creationState
fields.description:
Different video qualities are being created in the background.
The creation state indicates when the source quality clip is playable
and transcoding of the clip in other video qualities has begun.

fields.name: curator
fields.description: The user who created the clip.

fields.name: durationSeconds
fields.description: The duration of the clip, in seconds.

fields.name: embedURL
fields.description: The URL used in the embed player.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game depicted in the clip.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The clip's unique identifier.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language of the clip.

fields.name: rawMedia
fields.description: Metadata around the raw media.

fields.name: rawVideoQualities
fields.description: The different quality options of this clip's raw media used for editing.

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: The reactions associated with this clips.

fields.name: relatedClips
fields.description: Lists of related clips based on different algorithms.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: A URL-friendly identifier.

fields.name: thumbnailURL
fields.description:
A URL to a thumbnail image.
Valid sizes are "86x45", "260x147", and "480x272".

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the clip.

fields.name: url
fields.description: A URL to the clip's page.

fields.name: video
fields.description:
The video of the clip. Because not all broadcasts are archived, not all clips will
have a video.

fields.name: videoOffsetSeconds
fields.description: The number of seconds into a VOD this clip was generated from.

fields.name: videoQualities
fields.description:
The different quality options of this clip available for playback.
The clip will first be available in the source video quality, indicated by when the
clipCreationState is 'CREATED'. videoQualities will gradually be added to afterwards as
more video quality options become playable.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: The number of times this clip has been viewed.

types.name: ClipConnection
types.description: A list of clips related to the subject.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The clips.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about pagination in this connection.

types.name: ClipCreationState
types.description: An enumeration on the different status strings returned by a clip status.

enumValues.name: CREATING
enumValues.description:
The creating status indicates that the source quality video is still
undergoing processing and transcoding.

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description:
Clip has been successfully created in the source video quality.
The field videoQualities will be gradually added to with other quality options.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
Clip creation failed and will remain in this state.
Possible errors can happen due to problems in downloading and slicing
the source of the original video, clipping offline channels, transcoding, etc.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this clip's position in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The clip.

types.name: ClipRawMedia
types.description: ClipRawMedia describes metadata about the clip's raw media used in clip editing.

fields.name: defaultClipInitialOffset
fields.description: Default Offset is the seconds into the raw clip media the default clip begins at.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Total duration of the raw media.

fields.name: filmStripFrames
fields.description: Total number of frames displayed in the spritesheet film strip.

fields.name: filmStripSecondsPerFrame
fields.description: Seconds covered by each frame in the spritesheet film strip.

fields.name: frameHeight
fields.description: Height of the frames displayed.

fields.name: frameWidth
fields.description: Width of the frames displayed.

fields.name: spritesheetURL
fields.description: Spritesheet displayed to user for clip editing.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the clip's raw media.

fields.name: videoURL
fields.description: URL link to the video mp4 containing to upwards of 90 seconds of the raw video from which the clip can be created from.

types.name: ClipRelatedClips
types.description:
There are different algorithms that return a different set of related clips.
They only return up to 4 clips per list.

fields.name: broadcaster
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same broadcaster created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: combined
fields.description:
Up-to 10 clips, in order, combined from the other returned clip sets.
Clips are included in the priority of similar, broadcaster, game, and then top.

fields.name: curator
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same user created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: game
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same game created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: similar
fields.description: Up-to 4 similar clips, based on the recommendations service.

fields.name: top
fields.description: Up-to 4 randomly selected, top viewed clips created within the last 4 days.

types.name: ClipSegmentInput
types.description: ClipSegmentInput represents a single segment of a clip.

inputFields.name: durationSeconds
inputFields.description: The number of seconds this clip segment encompasses.

inputFields.name: offsetSeconds
inputFields.description: The offset into the clip's 90 second raw media.

inputFields.name: speed
inputFields.description:
Valid input speeds are 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, and 2.0.
The segment speed will be set to 1 by default if unspecified.

types.name: ClipVideoQuality
types.description: ClipVideoQuality describes metadata about an available playback source for a clip.

fields.name: frameRate
fields.description:
Frame rate is the number of frames per second of this video.
This value is a 64-bit float, with a default value of 30.0,
and is used for supporting different playback speeds.
Frame rate will be empty for raw media video qualities.

fields.name: quality
fields.description:
Clips can have multiple playback qualities via transcoding.
Some examples of qualities include "1080", "720", "480", "360", and "source".

fields.name: sourceURL
fields.description: The source video URL for the clip in this specific playback quality.

types.name: ClipsFilter
types.description: The set of methods to restrict clips results.

enumValues.name: TRENDING
enumValues.description: Limit results to trending clips.

enumValues.name: LAST_DAY
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 24 hours.

enumValues.name: LAST_WEEK
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 7 days.

enumValues.name: LAST_MONTH
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 30 days.

enumValues.name: ALL_TIME
enumValues.description: No limit on clips creation period.

types.name: ClipsPeriod
types.description:
An enumeration on the different time frames to filter clips results based on
creation time.

enumValues.name: LAST_DAY
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 24 hours.

enumValues.name: LAST_WEEK
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 7 days.

enumValues.name: LAST_MONTH
enumValues.description: Limit results to clips created in the period between now and the last 30 days.

enumValues.name: ALL_TIME
enumValues.description: No limit on when the clips were created.

types.name: ClipsSort
types.description: An enumeration on the different sort orders of clips results.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT_ASC
enumValues.description: Sort the clips ascending by created_at.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT_DESC
enumValues.description: Sort the clips descending by created_at.

enumValues.name: VIEWS_ASC
enumValues.description: Sort the clips ascending by views.

enumValues.name: VIEWS_DESC
enumValues.description: Sort the clips descending by views.

enumValues.name: TRENDING
enumValues.description: Sort the clips descending by popularity.

types.name: Community
types.description:
A community is a social structure of Twitch users. Streamers may use them to
reach viewers interested in a specific type of content, and viewers can use them
to discover that content.

fields.name: avatarURL
fields.description:
URL to an avatar image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: broadcastersCount
fields.description: Number of broadcasters currently broadcasting in this community.

fields.name: communityType
fields.description:
Communities can have types: "gaming", "creative" or "other" (user-created communities).
When you're sorting through communities, you can filter them by these types, optionally.

fields.name: coverURL
fields.description:
URL to a cover image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.description:

types.name: CreatePanelInput
types.description:
CreatePanelInput contains a panel with created data
The schema here has arguments for both extension panels and default panels
each panel needs a PanelType, and channelID it corresponds to,
but each panel does not need the other arguments
extension panels can have a slotID
default panels can have a title, image, link, and/or description.

types.name: DeprecatedEvent
types.description:
Deprecated

An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

The Event interface is the common set of fields that all events support.  There are several concrete Event types
that represent different kinds of scheduled content.  The kinds of content include one-off events, premieres,
tournaments, conferences and panels, shows and episodes etc.
The concrete Event types include additional fields that are needed to describe their kind of content.

NOTE: Clients should be resilient to new concrete types being added in the future.

NOTE: Events have been designed here using polymorphic types.
This is a (mostly) untested design pattern for API types, and we are currently learning about its advantages
and disadvantages.
Teams are encouraged to avoid polymorphic types and design their types to use composition instead, if possible.

fields.description: When this event was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Event's unique identifier.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this event.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this event.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this event was last modified.

types.description:
Paginated list of Events, where the relationship between the source type and the Event is
generic enough that no information needs to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: DeprecatedEventEdge
types.description:
Generic edge between some type and an Event, where there is no information that needs to
to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: DropCampaign
types.description:
A campaign a developer is running to give drops away to viewers of their game
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times
To apply to a particular channel a campaign must be live and additionally
the channel must be playing an applicable game and either must be one of the
applicable channels or the campaign must have an empty applicable channel list
(where an empty list specifically means all channels are eligible).

fields.name: applicableChannels
fields.description:
What channels this campaign is targeted to
(Empty list == all channels for the games are allowed)
An applicable channel must also be playing an applicable game for the
campaign to apply to the channel.

fields.name: applicableGames
fields.description:
The games that this campaign is enabled on
A channel playing one of these games must be in the applicable channels
list or list must be empty for the campaign to apply to the channel.

fields.name: awardableDrops
fields.description: The drops this campaign can award.

fields.name: connectionURL
fields.description:
The URL users who aren't linked should click on to create a link that will
allow them create an account link for the developer of the game(s)
this campaign is for.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description:
The time this campaign ends
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

fields.name: id
fields.description: GUID identifying this campaign.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description:
If this campaign is enabled
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description:
The time this campaign starts
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

EmbeddedEmote is an encoding format used to describe an emote embedded in a string of text.

Example:
  body = "hey KappaHD"
  from = 4

types.name: Event
types.description:
An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

There are currently two high-level categories of events.  EventLeaf, which is a single event that may or may
not be part of a collection, or an EventCollection that groups leaves together.

When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

types.name: EventConnectionCriteriaInput
types.description: Generic options for filtering pages of events.

inputFields.name: endsAfter
inputFields.description: Select for events that end after this time.

inputFields.name: endsBefore
inputFields.description: Select for events that end before this time.

inputFields.name: firstPageOptions
inputFields.description:
Defines the strategies that are used to determine where the first page of events should start within the complete
list of events.  Moving forwards or backwards past this first page is possible using standard Relay pagination.
The options are processed in order, and if an option cannot be fulfilled (e.g. if the first option states to
start at a particular ID, but the ID does not exist in the list), then the next option is considered.
If no options can be fulfilled, or no options are given, the first page will start at the first event
after sorting and ordering.

inputFields.name: gameIDs
inputFields.description:
Select for events that involve at least one game that corresponds to the given game IDs.  If left unspecified,
no filtering by game is done.

inputFields.name: sortBy
inputFields.description: Sort by specific params; defaults to STARTTIME.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: Sort order; defaults to ASC.

inputFields.name: startsAfter
inputFields.description: Select for events that start after this time.

inputFields.name: startsBefore
inputFields.description: Select for events that start before this time.

types.name: EventConnectionFirstPageInput
types.description:
Defines where the first page of a listing of events starts.
Each field allows specifying a strategy to pick the first event on the first page.  Clients should
only set one of these fields to choose a strategy, and leave the others null.

inputFields.name: endsAfter
inputFields.description:
The first page of the listing starts with the first event that has an end time after the given time.
This option is only applicable when sorting by start time in ascending order.

inputFields.name: eventID
inputFields.description:
The first event in the listing is the event that correspond to the given ID.
This option is applicable for all sort options and orderings.

enumValues.name: PROMPT_FOR_PERMISSIONS

enumValues.name: REQUIRES_CONFIGURATION

types.name: ExtensionState
types.description: The possible values for ExtensionState.

enumValues.name: IN_TEST
enumValues.description: IN_TEST extensions are currently being worked on by a developer.

enumValues.name: READY_FOR_REVIEW
enumValues.description:
READY_FOR_REVIEW extensions are currently being examined by a developer for their readiness
to be reviewed (assets hosted on CDN).

enumValues.name: IN_REVIEW
enumValues.description: IN_REVIEW extensions are being looked at by Twitch.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: REJECTED extensions are permanently rejected; no action by the  developer will make them acceptable.

enumValues.name: APPROVED
enumValues.description: APPROVED extensions are ready to be released, at the developer's convenience.

enumValues.name: RELEASED
enumValues.description:
RELEASED extensions are currently available to users.  Only one version of an extension
can be in this state at any time.

enumValues.name: DEPRECATED
enumValues.description: DEPRECATED extensions were once released, but a newer version now exists.

enumValues.name: PENDING_ACTION
enumValues.description: PENDING_ACTION extensions are ones that were reviewed by Twitch and returned to the developer for fixing.

enumValues.name: UPLOADING
enumValues.description: UPLOADING extensions are in the process of having their assets loaded onto S3.

enumValues.name: ASSETS_UPLOADED
enumValues.description:
ASSETS_UPLOADED extensions have had their assets uploaded already to S3. This state mirrors
the existing READY_FOR_REVIEW state, but doesn't incur an implicit upload.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: DELETED extensions have been deleted; this is a soft delete so we can undelete things.

types.name: ExtensionStateFilter
types.description: ExtensionStateFilter contains all the valid states to filter the list of extensions by.

enumValues.name: RELEASED
enumValues.description: Released extension.

inputFields.name: firstPageOptions
inputFields.description:
Defines the strategies that are used to determine where the first page of events should start within the complete
list of events.  Moving forwards or backwards past this first page is possible using standard Relay pagination.
The options are processed in order, and if an option cannot be fulfilled (e.g. if the first option states to
start at a particular ID, but the ID does not exist in the list), then the next option is considered.
If no options can be fulfilled, or no options are given, the first page will start at the first event
after sorting and ordering.

types.name: Milestone
types.description:
Milestone is a construct is used within a tournament. For a given threshold, when the user 
cheers at or past this amount, they are able to claim a reward for cheering at this level.
Rewards can be fulfilled by different platforms.
Types of milestones:
- **Global milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when cheers from all 
  users on the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for all users who have cheered.
- **Individual milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual 
  user's total cheers in the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.
- **Team milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual cheers 
  for a specific team in total is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.

NOTE: Should have been named CheeringTournamentMilestone.

fields.name: threshold

fields.name: addBrowserPushSubscription
fields.description:
addBrowserPushSubscription adds a browser push subscription for receiving browser (desktop) push notifications.
The client must retrieve the input fields from the browser's push notification API. Client's will
call this when the user opts-in. A browser push subscription is tied to a user's browser (device).
Twitch will use these push subscriptions to send browser push notifications.

Spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/push-api/#push-subscription.

https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

fields.description:
The URL or a URL template to the cover image for this event.
An optional width and height can be given to specify the dimension of the image in pixels.
If left unspecified, this field will be a URL template with {width} and {height} placeholders
that the client can replace to create a functional URL.
When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

types.name: PurchaseProfile
types.description: Purchase profile of a recurring or non-recurring subscription that a user bought.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description: Cancels the entitled benefit and refunds if isRefundable is true.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date this purchase profile was created.

fields.name: extPurchaserID
fields.description: Usually the Twitch user's ID, but recorded by the payment provider.

fields.name: extSubscriptionID
fields.description: The external subscription ID recorded by the payment provider.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the Purchase Profile in Payments team database.

fields.name: isGift
fields.description: Whether this purchase profile was gifted to the ticketOwnerID by another user.

fields.name: isPaying
fields.description: Whether this purchase profile is being paid for.

fields.name: productType
fields.description: Product type of the purchase.

fields.name: purchaserEmail
fields.description: Twitch purchaser's email.

fields.name: purchaserID
fields.description: Twitch purchaser's user ID.

fields.name: purchaserName
fields.description: Twitch purchaser's real name.

fields.name: renewalCurrency
fields.description: Currency for the renewalPrice, e.g. "USD".

fields.name: renewalPrice
fields.description: Expected renewal price of the product in the smallest subunit of the currency, e.g. "499".

fields.name: renewalStoppedAt
fields.description: Different from cancellation in that it stops renewal but let's user keep the benefit until it expires.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the purchase profile. i.e. cancelling the purchase profile can set state to 'cancelled'.

fields.name: subscriptionBenefit
fields.description: Subscription benefit associated with this purchase profile, if still active.

fields.name: ticketID
fields.description: The ticket ID mapped to this purchase profile, tickets are owned by the subscriptions team.

fields.name: ticketOwnerID
fields.description: Twitch user ID, owner of the entitlement benefit.

fields.name: ticketProductOwnerID
fields.description: Twitch user ID, owner of the channel that was subscribed to.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Date this purchase profile was last updated.

fields.name: willRenew
fields.description: Whether this purchase profile will renew in the future and charge the user's payment method.

types.name: PurchaseToken
types.description:
PurchaseToken is a token that appears in the chat, specific to 
a tuid/channel (i.e. if a customer buys a product, we give them the option of 
sharing it in the channel they bought it from).

fields.name: asin
fields.description:
asin is the purchased Amazon ASIN (a unique identifier for products at 
Amazon) to be shared.

fields.name: badges
fields.description:
badges is the set of badges to be shared.  There may be duplicate badges
associated with the same token.

fields.name: bits
fields.description: bits is the set of bits to be shared.

fields.name: crateCount
fields.description: crateCount is the number of crates associated with the purchase.

fields.name: emoteSets
fields.description:
emoteSets is the set of emote sets to be shared.  There may be duplicate
emote sets associated with the same token.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique message identifier.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
imageURL is the URL for the image to be used for the purchase token.
An optional width can be specified to return an image of the given width. If
no size is specified the images native size will be used.

fields.name: inGameContents
fields.description: In game content is the in game content to be shared.

fields.name: status
fields.description: status is the status of the purchase token.

fields.name: timeReceived
fields.description: timeReceived is the time the chat token token was created.

fields.name: title
fields.description: title is the title to be used for the purchase token.

fields.name: token
fields.description: token is the consumable purchase token.

types.name: Query
types.description: Root fields to access the Twitch API.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: A list of global chat badges.

fields.name: bitsOffers
fields.description: Gets a list of Bits offers for a logged out user, for use on the Bits landing page.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Get a channel by ID or name.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: Get a list of channels, either by IDs or by their names.

fields.name: chatRoomBanStatus
fields.description: Get the ban status of a usser with respect to a channel's chat room.

fields.name: clip
fields.description: Get a clip by slug.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Get a single collection (playlist) item by its ID.

fields.name: community
fields.description:
Get a single community by its ID or name
Will error if both id and name are supplied.

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description:
The currently authenticated user.
Returns null if the user is not authenticated.

fields.name: deprecatedEvent
fields.description: Get an Event by ID.
fields.deprecationReason: Migratory field that clients who want to use the deprecated version of events can consume

fields.name: directories
fields.description:
Fetch directories in specified sort order, optionally filtered to the specified type.
Filters are additive, meaning that using two filters will include results from both types.
An empty filter list implies that no filters are applied, hence all results are included regardless of type.
By default returns 10, sorted by descending total viewer count, unfiltered.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Fetch a single directory by name and type.

fields.name: event
fields.description: Get an Event by ID.

fields.name: eventBroadcast
fields.description: Get an EventBraodcast by ID.

fields.name: extension
fields.description:
Get an Extension by ID. Optionally, provide a specific version. If no version is provided,
the released version of that extension is returned.

fields.name: extensions
fields.description:
Search extensions by text found in the Extension name, description or summary. The results are
always returned in order of popularity. By default, all RELEASED and IN_TEST extensions are returned.
Pass RELEASED as the value of 'state' to only return extensions in the RELEASED state.

fields.name: featuredContentSections
fields.description:
Fetch the sections & content that should be featured on mobile
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (e.g. "en").

fields.name: featuredStreams
fields.description:
Fetch streams that are featured on the front page, ordered by featurePriority ascending.
DEPRECATED: `geolocation` is computed based on GeoIP with a fallback value of "US" and should be omitted
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (ex. "en")
By default returns 6 streams.

fields.name: featuredVideos
fields.description:
Fetch VODs that should be featured on the homepage
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (e.g. "en").

fields.name: feed
fields.description: Get a Feed by ID.

fields.name: feedEmbed
fields.description: Convert a URL to an object that can be embedded into Twitch feeds.

fields.name: feedItemContent
fields.description: Get a feed item by ID.

fields.name: game
fields.description: Get a single game as identified by its name.

fields.name: games
fields.description:
Fetch games in order of descending popularity.
By default returns 10.

fields.name: merchandise
fields.description: Get a list of all Twitch Merch products.

fields.name: primeOffers
fields.description:
Get Current PrimeOffers for a given region based on country code (request info or query param)
optional dateOverride to provide offers that would be displayed on that date
optional countryCode to provide offers that are displayed for that country
optional locale to provide offers displayed for the supplied locale.

fields.name: primePromotions
fields.description:
PrimePromotions data - query supports optional identifiers for promotion strings but default behavior will use
countryCode and userID to find available marketing promotions. For whitelisted QA users dateOverride can be provided.

fields.name: rejectedChatMessage
fields.description: Get a message rejected by chat.

fields.name: reportReasons
fields.description: Get a list of valid reasons for a content type.

fields.name: requestInfo
fields.description: Metadata about the request to the API.

fields.name: room
fields.description: Get a room by its ID.

fields.name: streams
fields.description:
Fetch live streams, ordered by the number of viewers descending.
languages can be empty or null, which will imply all the languages are included on the results.

fields.name: subscriptionProduct
fields.description:
Get a subscription product by its name. See product name examples below. The productName uniquely identifies a product.

e.g. "meclipse", "meclipse_2000", "meclipse_3000", these are respectively, the tier 1, 2, and 3 subscription product
names for the user with login "shroud".

fields.name: user
fields.description:
Get a user by their ID or login.
If no ID or login is provided, null is returned.

fields.name: users
fields.description: Get a list of users, either by their logins or by their IDs.

fields.name: video
fields.description:
Get a video by its ID.
By default, Video queries only return public videos.
If the owner should also see their own private videos, set includePrivate flag in the `options` input.
This flag does not include other people's private videos.

fields.name: videoComments
fields.description: A paginated list of comments against id, videoID, or channelID.

fields.name: videos
fields.description: Get a list of videos in order of descending popularity.

fields.name: whisperThread
fields.description: Get a whisper thread by ID.

fields.name: count
fields.description: count of users that reacted with a particular Emote.

fields.name: emote
fields.description: The Emote associated with the Reaction.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this reaction.

fields.name: hasReacted
fields.description: Did the authenticated user react.

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description: IDs of the notifications to set as read. The minimum number is 1 and the maximum is 100.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The amount of notifications that were set to read.

fields.name: notifications
fields.description: The notifications that were set to read. Only ID and isRead are accessible.

fields.name: friends
fields.description: A list of recommended friends.

fields.name: liveRecommendations
fields.description:
Live recommendations.
recRequestID is a tracking id created by the caller. Should be unique per request.

fields.name: streams
fields.description: Stream recommendations.

fields.name: videos
fields.description: A list of recommended VODs.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason why this recommendation was made.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user recommended to be a friend of the source user.

fields.name: stream
fields.description: The recommended stream.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of recommendation. Different types contain different metadata about why the recommendation was made.

fields.name: setID
fields.description: A unique ID for this generated list of recommendations.

fields.name: braintreeClientAuthorization
fields.description: For interacting with the Braintree gateway and Paypal (supported by Recurly).

fields.name: payWithAmazonConfigs
fields.description: For interacting with Pay With Amazon gateway (supported by Recurly).

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: Sent to Recurly to identify requests.

types.name: RitualToken
types.description:
A ritual is an opportunity for a viewer to better connect with a streamer's
community by announcing when they reach milestones in the channel.
A ritual token is issued when a user is eligible for the ritual, and can be
redeemed to send the announcement in a channel.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel that the user can redeem the ritual token in.

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description:
The time after which the ritual is considered expired and can no longer be
redeemed. Clients should dismiss the ritual UI if it's still shown after
this time. Null if the ritual never expires.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique ID for the ritual token.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the ritual token.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the ritual to be redeemed.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user that owns the ritual token.

enumValues.name: ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: ELIGIBLE means a user does not have this token, but can request one.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: AVAILABLE means a user has been granted this token and it can be redeemed.

enumValues.name: DISMISSED
enumValues.description: DISMISSED means a user has opted out of redeeming this token.

enumValues.name: REDEEMED
enumValues.description: REDEEMED means a user has successfully consumed this token.

enumValues.name: NEW_CHATTER
enumValues.description: NEW_CHATTER is granted 5 minutes after a user joins a channel for the first time.

Describes the role a user must be in order to perform an action, such as sending messages. Roles are
hierarchical, so users that meet a role also meet all lower roles as well. For example, a moderator
meets the subscriber role, even if they are not subscribed to the channel. Roles are defined in order
from highest to lowest in the enum.

types.name: SegmentEvent
types.description:
Segment events are sub-events that represent a piece of content that is part of a greater event.
SegmentEvent would be good at representing:
  * A single run of a gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the runs for "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" together.
  * A single panel in a conference like "TwitchCon 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the panels for the conference together.

types.name: SetSessionStatusInput
types.description:
SetSessionStatusInput represents a user's status within a single session (browser tab, game, desktop application,
mobile application, etc.).

inputFields.name: activity
inputFields.description:
activity is the action the user is performing in your application. The purpose of an activity is to allow the user's
friends and related users to join in on whatever the user is doing. If the user is not performing any action that
other users can join in on (e.g. watching a VOD, browsing their settings page) or is not performing any action at
all, this should be set to null.

inputFields.name: availability
inputFields.description:
availability is the state of the user's session in your application. You should set it to ONLINE if the user is
known to be at their device, IDLE if they are not, and OFFLINE if your application is currently terminating.

Note that if your application fails to send an OFFLINE heartbeat before terminating, the session will automatically
expire after some time without a heartbeat.

inputFields.name: sessionID
inputFields.description:
sessionID must be supplied and can be any string unique to this session. Generating a random UUID when your
application starts and sending it for each setSessionStatus is a good idea.

Each instance of your application should send the same ID for each of its setSessionStatus calls, but two instances
of your application running at the same time should never have the same session ID.

fields.name: setAgainInSeconds
fields.description:
The number of seconds your application should wait before sending another setSessionStatus. If your application does
not call setSessionStatus again within roughly this duration, it will be assumed to have terminated unexpectedly and
its session status for this user will expire.

fields.description: The modified user.

fields.description:
The Twitch user that is the owner of the channel associated with this subscription product.
This is null for SubscriptionProducts like 'turbo' that are not associated with any user.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price, e.g. "$9.99".

fields.name: self
fields.description: The connection for user to the subscription product.

fields.name: thirdPartyTemplateSKU
fields.description:
ThirdPartytemplateSKU is used by the frontend to retrieve third party product information such
as price. templateSKU is exposed separately from purchaseSKU since retrieving purchaseSKU is a
more expensive operation. A user may not be able to purchase the templateSKU. Use purchaseSKU
when the user has indiciated they want to purchase.
Uses Client-ID to determine platform information and IP address to determine location.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: The tier of the product.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of subscription, e.g. "chansub" or "teamsub".

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for this subscription's purchase page.

types.name: SubscriptionProductSelfConnection
types.description: The connection between the user and subscription product.

fields.name: benefit
fields.description: This user's subscription benefit information for the subscription product.

fields.name: checkoutConfigs
fields.description:
Holds configuration necessary to start subscription purchase checkout flow for this product for current user.
The user completing the checkout can get the subscription benefit for themself or for a gift recipient.
Only the authenticated user can access their own configs.

fields.name: discountType
fields.description: The subscription's discount type (e.g. "percent_off").

fields.name: discountValue
fields.description: The discount value of the subscription product (e.g. "50").

fields.name: isEligibleForDiscount
fields.description: If the product is eligible for a discount.

fields.name: newPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price after discount (e.g. "$2.49").

fields.name: oldPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price before discount (e.g. "$4.99").

fields.name: promotion
fields.description: The subscription product's promotion for user if eligible.

fields.name: purchase
fields.description:
This user's subscription purchase details for the subscription product. If this user is not
subscribed to the product, then the result's state is 'inactive'. If a compatible purchase exists,
then the result's "compatiblePurchase" field is present.

fields.name: thirdPartyPurchaseSKU
fields.description:
ThirdPartyPurchaseSKU is different from templateSKU since it represents the SKU of the exact item the
user will purchase. It is more expensive to retrieve purchaseSKU than templateSKU, so only
use purchaseSKU when the user has indicated they want to checkout. Use templateSKU on channel
page load to retrieve product information.

Will return an error if the user has no purchasable skus. Will return nil if not on a platform
with an external subscription product or if the country is not supported.
Uses Client-ID to determine platform information and IP address to determine location.

types.name: TimetableChildEvent
types.description:
TimetableChildEvent defines the types of sub-events that a TimetableEvent may contain.
NOTE: Clients should be resilient to TimetableChildEvent including new types in the future.

types.name: TimetableChildEventConnection
types.description: Paginated list of sub-events that are part of a TimetableEvent.

types.name: TimetableEvent
types.description:
TimetableEvent describes an event that comprises of a collection of closely related sub-events.
TimetableEvent would be good at representing:
  * A gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" which each run is its own piece of content that can
    be represented by a SegmentEvent
  * A conference like "TwitchCon 2017" where each panel is its own piece of content that can be represented
    by a SegmentEvent.

fields.name: channels
fields.description:
The channels where this event's children will be broadcast.
The channels will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: children
fields.description:
The sub events that make up this Timetable event.
Note that this connection supports both forwards and backwards pagination.  Clients must supply the "first" and
"after" params to page forwards, or "last" and "before" to page backwards.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When this event was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this event.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: The time that this event ends.

fields.name: games
fields.description:
The games that will be played during this event.
The games will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Event's unique identifier.

fields.name: imageID
fields.description: The chosen image ID for this event.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
The URL or a URL template to the cover image for this event.
An optional width and height can be given to specify the dimension of the image in pixels.
If left unspecified, this field will be a URL template with {width} and {height} placeholders
that the client can replace to create a functional URL.
When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: The time that this event starts.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this event was last modified.

types.name: Tournament
types.description:
Tournament is an object that contains all information about a tournament
managed within Bits for a specific event tied to cheering.
NOTE: Should have been named CheeringTournament.

fields.name: globalLeaderboard
fields.description: Leaderboard of all users who have cheered in the tournament.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Event ID of the tournament.

fields.name: progress
fields.description:
The list of global milestones that can be claimed in the tournament.
For a given threshold, this milestone is reached when cheers from all users on the channel
is greater than or equal to the threshold. This unlocks a reward for all users who have cheered.

fields.name: rewards
fields.description:
The list of rewards that are a part of the tournament. This is separated out into global, participant, and individual
rewards that can be claimed if the user is logged in.

fields.name: self
fields.description:
The list of individual milestones that can be claimed in the tournament.
for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual user's total cheers in
the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold. This unlocks a reward
for the individual user who cheered.

fields.name: teamLeaderboard
fields.description:
Leaderboard of all teams who have been cheered for in the tournament. This leaderboard contains how much each team
in the tournament was cheered for.

fields.name: teams
fields.description: The list of teams participating in the tournament.

fields.name: inGameContent
fields.description: In Game Content rewards, like sprays and avatars (non-hero skin rewards).

fields.name: maxLength
fields.description: On NAME_LENGTH_INVALID, TOPIC_LENGTH_INVALID: Maximum number of characters.

fields.name: minLength
fields.description: On NAME_LENGTH_INVALID, TOPIC_LENGTH_INVALID: Minimum number of characters.

enumValues.name: FORBIDDEN
enumValues.description: User does not have permission to update room.

enumValues.name: ROOM_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Could not find a room with the given room ID.

enumValues.name: NAME_LENGTH_INVALID
enumValues.description: Name too short or too long.

enumValues.name: NAME_CONTAINS_INVALID_CHARACTERS
enumValues.description: Name contains invalid characters (e.g. spaces).

enumValues.name: NAME_INAPPROPRIATE
enumValues.description: Name failed automod check.

enumValues.name: NAME_NOT_UNIQUE
enumValues.description: Name was not unique to channel.

enumValues.name: TOPIC_LENGTH_INVALID
enumValues.description: Topic too short or too long.

enumValues.name: TOPIC_INAPPROPRIATE
enumValues.description: Topic failed automod check.

enumValues.name: ROLES_INVALID
enumValues.description: Invalid roles specified (e.g. a more permissive role for send than read).

inputFields.name: isPreviewable
inputFields.description: Deprecated. Use minimumReadMessagesRole instead.

inputFields.name: minimumAllowedRole
inputFields.description: Deprecated. Use minimumReadMessagesRole and minimumSendMessagesRole instead.

inputFields.name: minimumReadMessagesRole
inputFields.description: Minimum role required to read messages in the room.

inputFields.name: minimumSendMessagesRole
inputFields.description: Minimum role required to send messages in the room.

fields.name: maximumSlowModeDurationSeconds
fields.description: On SLOW_MODE_DURATION_INVALID: Maximum number of seconds slow mode can be set to.

fields.name: minimumSlowModeDurationSeconds
fields.description: On SLOW_MODE_DURATION_INVALID: Minimum number of seconds slow mode can be set to.

enumValues.name: ROOM_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: RoomID referred to an invalid or the user does not have permissions to see the room.

enumValues.name: FORBIDDEN
enumValues.description: User did not have permission to update room modes.

enumValues.name: SLOW_MODE_DURATION_INVALID
enumValues.description: Slow mode duration was too short, too long, or not a number.

inputFields.name: enableEmotesOnlyMode
inputFields.description: Turns emotes only mode on or off.

inputFields.name: enableR9KMode
inputFields.description: Turns r9k mode on or off.

inputFields.name: enableSlowMode
inputFields.description: Turns slow mode on or off.

inputFields.name: slowModeDurationSeconds
inputFields.description: If slow mode enabled, the number of seconds users must wait between messages.

types.name: User
types.description: Twitch user.

fields.name: accountConnections
fields.description: Information about a user's connected accounts.

fields.name: activity
fields.description:
The computed state of a user or session.
This special field only resolves for the authenticated user; use friends.edges.activity to retrieve this
information about friends.
Requires the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: amazon
fields.description: The user's relationship with Amazon.

fields.name: amazonMarketplaces
fields.description: amazonMarketplaces returns a list of Amazon marketplaces in which this user is active in.

fields.name: autoModProperties
fields.description:
AutoModProperties is a mapping of automod categories to levels, i.e. a user has indicated they want level 4, or
the highest level of moderation for profanity, but level 1 for everything else.

fields.name: autohostChannels
fields.description:
The list of channel that this user has configured to automatically host
when their channel is not streaming live. Users can only view their own
autohost channels.

fields.name: autohostSettings
fields.description:
Options and preferences for autohost behavior, including whether
autohosting is enabled at all and how to choose which channel to host.
Users can only view their own autohost settings.

fields.name: availability
fields.description:
An action that a user or session is performing.
This special field only resolves for the authenticated user; use friends.edges.availability to retrieve this
information about friends..
Requires the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: availableBadges
fields.description:
The badges which are available for the authenticated user to select for use on another user's streams and videos if no channel-specific preference is set.
If no domain is not specified, all emote sets will be returned.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: bannedUsers
fields.description:
A list of this user's banned users.
A maximum of 100 users by most recent are returned
Only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: bannerImageURL
fields.description: A URL to the user's banner image.

fields.name: bitsBalance
fields.description:
bitsBalance is the number of bits this user currently has available to spend.
If this isn't the `currentUser` or the user has been banned from using bits this will return null.
This field can only be requested if an OAuth token is supplied with the request.

fields.name: bitsOffers
fields.description:
bitsOffers is a list of the ways this user can obtain more bits.
If this isn't the `currentUser` or the user has been banned from using bits this will return null.
This field can only be requested if an OAuth token is supplied with the request.

fields.name: blizzardAccount
fields.description: Resolves account information that Twitch has stored for a user's blizzard account information.

fields.name: blockedTerms
fields.description: Get the blocked terms of a user.

fields.name: blockedUsers
fields.description: blockedUsers returns a list users that are restrained from directly communicating with this user.

fields.name: bounties
fields.description: bounties is a list of bounty board bounties for this user.

fields.name: bountyBoardSettings
fields.description: bountyBoardSettings are settings and rules around the behavior of bounty boards for this user.

fields.name: broadcastBadges
fields.description: Badges that are displayed in chat during this user's broacasts or videos.

fields.name: broadcastSettings
fields.description: A User's broadcast settings that persists between streams.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel which belongs to the user.
fields.deprecationReason: Channel has been deprecated and its fields have been merged into User.

fields.name: channelFeed
fields.description:
A user's channel feed.
No authorization required.  Returns even if channel feed is disabled in the UI.

fields.name: channelRooms
fields.description: Returns the list of chatrooms in the channel visible by the current user.

fields.name: chatColor
fields.description: Hex color of the user's name in chat, e.g. "#ccaa44".

fields.name: chatSettings
fields.description: chatSettings are settings and rules for chatting in this user's channel.

fields.name: cheer
fields.description:
cheer is the channel-specific cheer settings and current state.
Returns null if cheering isn't enabled for this channel.

fields.name: clientAuthorizations
fields.description: The list of OAuth clients authorized by the current user.

fields.name: clips
fields.description:
A paginated list of clips featuring this user.
When criteria is not specified, the default values are used.

fields.name: collections
fields.description: A paginated list of collections (playlists) created by the user.

fields.name: crates
fields.description:
A list of Twitch crates in a user's inventory.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user who's email is requested.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the user created their account.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A user-provided blurb describing themselves.

fields.name: directories
fields.description: The directories the user is currently set to broadcast in.

fields.name: displayBadges
fields.description:
Lists the chat badges that should be displayed by the user's display name in
features like chat and whispers. If a channelID is passed in, fetches the
display badges that user will have in that channel's context.
Includes the following badges:
- global authority (staff/admin/global mod)
- channel authority (broadcaster/mod, if channelID is set)
- subscriber (if channelID is set)
- channel selected (bits) or global selected (prime, turbo, ...).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
A user-styled version of their login.
For international users, this could be the user's login with localized characters.

fields.name: email
fields.description:
The user's email address.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user who's email is requested.

fields.name: emoteSets
fields.description:
The emote sets this user is entitled to use.
If no domains are specified, all emote sets will be returned.
If multiple domains are specified, emotes that belong to either domain are returned (OR).
If this user is not the current user, it returns nil and a "forbidden" error.

fields.name: eventLeaves
fields.description:
Paginated list of leaf events that will or have run on theis user's channel.
This selects *all* leaves of all collections that this user might have assocated as well.
An optional criteria object can be given to specify the relevant time window that events should fall within, and
how the events are sorted.
NOTE: If no time window is given, this field will only contain upcoming events.

fields.name: events
fields.description:
Paginated list of events that will or have run on this user's channel.
An optional criteria object can be given to specify the relevant time window that events should fall within, and
how the events are sorted.
NOTE: If no time window is given, this field will only contain upcoming events.

fields.name: featureFlags
fields.description:
Feature flags specific to this user.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: follow
fields.description:
A follow relationship between this user and the one which has the target ID or login.
Null if no relationship exists.

fields.name: followedCommunities
fields.description:
A list of communities this user is following, ordered by most viewers.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: followedEvents
fields.description: Paginated list of events that this user is currently following.

fields.name: followedGames
fields.description: Retrieves a list of games which the user is following.

fields.name: followedHosts
fields.description:
A list of broadcasters this user follows, who are hosting other broadcasters.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is intended to be replaced as soon as an alternative is available.

fields.name: followedLiveUsers
fields.description:
A list of live-streaming broadcasters this user is following.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is intended to be replaced as soon as an alternative is available.

fields.name: followedVideos
fields.description:
Retrieves recent/popular VODs from the streamers you follow.
If this isn't the `currentUser` this will return null.

fields.name: followers
fields.description: A paginated list of users which follow this user.

fields.name: follows
fields.description: A paginated list of users this user is following.

fields.name: friends
fields.description:
A list of this user's Twitch friends.
A maximum of 500 friends are returned, although most users have less than the maximum.
Only accessible if the user is authenticated with the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: hasPrime
fields.description: Whether this user has Twitch Prime.

fields.name: hasTurbo
fields.description: Whether this user has Twitch Turbo.

fields.name: hosting
fields.description: The user who this user is hosting.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The user's unique identifier.

fields.name: idSHA1
fields.description: Returns a SHA-1 hash of the id field.

fields.name: incomingFriendRequests
fields.description:
A list of open friend requests sent to this user. Friend requests from non-strangers are always placed in front of
friend requests from strangers; `sort` affects how the two components are ordered within themselves. Only accessible
if the user is authenticated with the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: installedExtensions
fields.description: The list of extensions the user has installed.

fields.name: inventory
fields.description: Items (crates, drops, etc.) the user owns.

fields.name: isCommerceRevShareEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not the broadcaster is eligible for payout through twitch game commerce revenue share.

fields.name: isConnectedToTwitter
fields.description:
Whether the user's Twitch account is connected to a Twitter account.
Returns nil if there was an error. This field is only accessible on the current user.

fields.name: isEmailVerified
fields.description: Whether or not the user has verified their email address by clicking a link sent to their email.

fields.name: isGlobalMod
fields.description: Whether or not the user can moderate any broadcast chat.

fields.name: isPartner
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a partnered broadcaster with Twitch.

fields.name: isSiteAdmin
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a site admininistrator.

fields.name: isStaff
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a Twitch staff member.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The user's language preference.

fields.name: lastBroadcast
fields.description: The user's last broadcast.

fields.name: lastStatusChangeAt
fields.description:
The last time the user's availability or activity changed.
This special field only resolves for the authenticated user; use friends.edges.lastStatusChangeAt to retrieve this
information about friends..
Requires the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: liveDeprecatedEvent
fields.description:
The event that the live stream is a part of.  If the channel is not live, or the stream is not associated with an
event, this field will be null.
fields.deprecationReason: Migratory field that clients who want to use the deprecated version of events can consume

fields.name: liveEvent
fields.description:
The event that the live stream is a part of.  If the channel is not live, or the stream is not associated with an
event, this field will be null.

fields.name: login
fields.description: The user's standard alphanumeric Twitch name.

fields.name: logoURL
fields.description:
The user's profile image.
Valid widths are 28, 50, 70, 150, 300, and 600.
The image height will be the same as the given width.

fields.name: managedEventCollections
fields.description:
Paginated list of event collections owned by this User.
The event collections are sorted by title in ascending order.

fields.name: managedEventLeaves
fields.description: Paginated list of event leaves owned by this User.

fields.name: maxAllowedChannelRooms
fields.description:
Returns the max number of channel rooms that the current user is allowed to
create for their channel.

fields.name: mods
fields.description: Returns a paginated list of channel moderators.

fields.name: notificationSettings
fields.description: A user's event notification settings.

fields.name: notifications
fields.description:
A user's notifications.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose onsite notifications are requested.
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (ex. "en").

fields.name: offlineImageURL
fields.description: A URL to the image that is displayed when the user is not broadcasting nor hosting another user's broadcast.

fields.name: onboarding
fields.description: Information about the current user's onboarding state.

fields.name: panels
fields.description: panels is a list of `Panel` objects with information related to this channel.

fields.name: payPalBillingAgreement
fields.description: User's PayPal billing agreement.

fields.name: payPalBillingAgreementURL
fields.description: URL where user can create or update their PayPal billing agreement.

fields.name: paymentMethodConfigs
fields.description:
Holds configuration necessary to start payment method management. Only the authenticated user can access their own configs.
This is the second step of the payment method management flow.
(User.paymentMethods -> User.paymentMethodConfigs -> Mutation.setDefaultPaymentMethod).

fields.name: paymentMethods
fields.description:
List of payment methods that will be used to pay for Twitch subscriptions that renew in the future
This is the first step of the payment method management flow.
(User.paymentMethods -> User.paymentMethodConfigs -> Mutation.setDefaultPaymentMethod).

fields.name: paymentTransactions
fields.description:
Get user's list of payment transactions. This currently aggregates subscriptions related transactions but plans
to also aggregate other product types such as Bits. The ultimate goal is to record, aggregate, and provide the
payment history of Twitch users in a convenient way.

fields.name: payoutInvite
fields.description: A user's invite into a payout program.

fields.name: payoutPlans
fields.description: List of payout plans a user has when enrolled in any payout programs.

fields.name: permittedTerms
fields.description: Get the permitted terms of a user.

fields.name: primaryTeam
fields.description:
The primary team this user belongs to. A user may belong to more than one team at the same time but must select a single
team as the primary. If the user doesn't have a primary team this will be null.

fields.name: primeSettings
fields.description: The Twitch Prime settings data for the user.

fields.name: profileImageURL
fields.description:
A URL to the user's profile image.
Valid widths are 28, 50, 70, 150, 300, and 600.
The image height will be the same as the given width.

fields.name: profileViewCount
fields.description: The number of views this user's profile has received since creation.

fields.name: programAgreement
fields.description: The program agreement for a user enrolled in a payout program.

fields.name: pulseFeed
fields.description:
A user's pulse feed.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: recommendations
fields.description:
Recommendations for the user. Recommendations can be retrieved only if the request
is authenticated and only for the authenticated user.

fields.name: residence
fields.description: User's declared country of residence.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: The roles this user fulfills on Twitch.

fields.name: searchVideos
fields.description: Search through a paginated list of public and private videos for this user.

fields.name: selectedBadge
fields.description: The badge this user has selected for global use on Twitch.

fields.name: self

current is the highest bits chat badge the authenticated user has achieved in this channel.

If the user hasn't earned any bits badges yet this will be null.

next is the next chat badge the authenticated user can earn in this channel.

If this is null then there are no higher tiers to earn.

fields.description:
progress is the fraction of the way the user is toward the next badge tier [0.0-1.0).
If `next` is null this will be zero.

fields.name: totalBits

fields.name: status
fields.description:
When broadcastType is:
- ARCHIVE: status goes from RECORDING to RECORDED.
- HIGHLIGHT: status goes from UNPROCESSED to RECORDED.
- UPLOAD: status goes from CREATED to UPLOADING, to PENDING_TRANSCODE, to RECORDED, or FAILED if anything goes wrong.
- PREMIERE_UPLOAD: status goes from CREATED to UPLOADING, to PENDING_TRANSCODE, to RECORDED, or FAILED if anything goes wrong.
- PAST_PREMIERE: status goes from RECORDING to RECORDED.

types.name: Visibility
types.description:
The user's shared availability while online.
A value of ONLINE (typically called invisibility) additionally means that the user's activity will not be shared
regardless of the isSharingActivity setting.
NOTE: Should have been named UserOnlineVisibility.

types.name: VisibilityInput
types.description: A visibility type for the user.

enumValues.name: ONLINE
enumValues.description:
An ONLINE visibility (default) will cause the user's availability to be inherited from their sessions -- Online if
they have at least one non-idle session, Away if they have only idle sessions, or Offline if they have no sessions.

enumValues.name: AWAY
enumValues.description:
An AWAY visibility will cause the user to appear as Away if they have any sessions, regardless of idleness, or
Offline if they have no sessions.

enumValues.name: BUSY
enumValues.description:
A BUSY visibility will cause the user to appear as Busy if they have any sessions, regardless of idleness, or
Offline if they have no sessions.

enumValues.name: OFFLINE
enumValues.description:
An OFFLINE visibility (also called "invisible") will cause the user to appear as Offline always. It will also
implicitly turn off activity sharing.
